info.title: Datatrans API Reference
info.description: Welcome to the Datatrans API reference. This document is meant to be used in combination with https://docs.datatrans.ch. All the parameters used in the curl and web samples are described here. Reach out to support@datatrans.ch if something is missing or unclear. Last updated: 24.03.21 - 13:17 UTC # Payment Process The following steps describe how transactions are processed with Datatrans. We separate payments in three categories: Customer-initiated payments, merchant-initiated payments and after the payment. ## Customer Initiated Payments We have three integrations available: [Redirect](https://docs.datatrans.ch/docs/redirect-lightbox), [Lightbox](https://docs.datatrans.ch/docs/redirect-lightbox) and [Secure Fields](https://docs.datatrans.ch/docs/secure-fields). ### Redirect & Lightbox - Send the required parameters to initialize a `transactionId` to the [init](#operation/init) endpoint. - Let the customer proceed with the payment by redirecting them to the correct link - or showing them your payment form. - Redirect: Redirect the browser to the following URL structure ``` https://pay.sandbox.datatrans.com/v1/start/transactionId ``` - Lightbox: Load the JavaScript library and initialize the payment form: ```js

tags.name: /v1/aliases
tags.description:
The aliases API gives you complete control over a Datatrans alias, be it a card number
alias or an alias of a non-card payment method such as PayPal, Postfinance etc.

Note that the operations of this API apply only to the most recent Datatrans alias format.
Please reach out to support@datatrans.ch if you are not sure which alias format you have in use.

### Alias access
By default, only the merchant that created the alias has access to it. Contact us, if you have a use case
where you need to share the alias.

post.description: Securely send all the needed parameters to the transaction initialization API. The result of this API call is a `HTTP 201` status code with a `transactionId` in the response body and the `Location` header set. This call is required to proceed with our Redirect and Lightbox integration

initRequest2.summary: Request with all possible 3D Secure 2.0 parameters

broadInfo.message: TLS 1.x will be turned off starting summer 2019

Location.description: A URL where the users browser needs to be redirect to complete the payment. This redirect is only needed when using Redirect Mode. For Lightbox Mode the returned `transactionId` can be used to start the payment page.

post.description: To create a transaction without user interaction, send all required parameters to our authorize endpoint. This is the API call for merchant-initiated transactions with an existing `alias`. Depending on the payment method, additional parameters will be required. Refer to the payment method specific objects (for example `PAP`) to see which parameters are required additionally send. For credit cards, the `card` object has to be used

autorizeRequest2.summary: Authorization request with a PayPal alias

post.description: Use this API endpoint to fully authorize an already authenticated transaction. This call is required for any transaction done with our Secure Fields or if during the initialization of a transaction the parameter `option.authenticationOnly` was set to `true`

schema.description: The `transactionId` received after authentication was done.

post.description: An existing alias can be validated at any time with the transaction validate API. No amount will be blocked on the customers account. Only credit cards (including Apple Pay and Google Pay), `PFC`, `KLN` and `PAP` support validation of an existing alias.

error.message: validate.currency must be a 3 letter ISO 4217 character code

post.description: The Settlement request is often also referred to as “Capture” or “Clearing”. It can be used for the settlement of previously authorized transactions. Only after settling a transaction the funds will be credited to your bank accountThe `transactionId` is needed to settle an authorization. This API call is not needed if `autoSettle` was set to `true` when [initializing a transaction](#operation/init).

schema.description: The transactionId received after an authorization.

error.message: settle transactionId length must be 18 digits

post.description: Cancel requests can be used to release a blocked amount from an authorization. The transaction must either be in status `authorized` or `settled`. The `transactionId` is needed to cancel an authorization

schema.description: The transactionId received after an authorization.

post.description: Use this API to make a credit without referring to a previous authorization. This can be useful if you want to credit a cardholder when there was no debit.
Refund requests can be used to credit a transaction which is in status `settled`. The previously settled amount must not be exceeded.

schema.description: The transactionId received after an authorization.

patch.summary: Update the amount of a Secure Fields transaction
patch.description: Use this API to update the amount of a Secure Fields transaction. This action is only allowed before the 3D process. At least one property must be updated.

schema.description: The `transactionId` received from the [Initialize a Secure Fields transaction](#operation/secureFieldsInit) call

get.summary: Checking the status of a transaction
get.description: The API endpoint status can be used to check the status of any transaction, see its history, and retrieve the card information.

schema.description: The transactionId received after an authorization.

error.message: status transactionId length must be 18 digits

delete.description: Delete an alias with immediate effect. The alias will no longer be recognized if used later with any API call.

schema.description: Alias received from a previous transaction if `option.createAlias=true` was used. In order to retrieve the alias from a previous transaction, use the [Status API](#operation/status).

post.description: Convert a legacy (numeric or masked) alias to the most recent alias format.

If you are a merchant using our reconciliation services, you can use this API to confirm a sale. The matching is based on the `transactionId`. The status of the transaction will change to `compensated`

If you are a merchant using our reconciliation services, you can use this API to confirm multiple sales with a single API call. The matching is based on the `transactionId`. The status of the transaction will change to `compensated`

alias.description: The new alias

message.description: A human readable message indicating what went wrong.
A human readable message indicating what went wrong.

transactionId.description: The transactionId received after an authorization.

saleDate.description: The date when the sale took place

reportedDate.description: The date when the sale was reported.

matchResult.description: The result after trying to match the reported sale.

date.description: The date when the transaction happened.

transactionId.description: The transactionId received after an authorization.

currency.description: 3 letter ISO-4217 character code. For example `CHF` or `USD`

amount.description: The amount of the transaction in the currency’s smallest unit. For example use 1000 for CHF 10.00.

refno.description: The merchant's reference number. It should be unique for each transaction.

message.description: A human readable message indicating what went wrong.

transactionId.description: The transactionId to use for subsequent actions like settlement.

acquirerAuthorizationCode.description: The authorization code returned by the acquirer or payment method provider.

message.description: A human readable message indicating what went wrong.

mimeType.description: The mime type of the attachment

value.description: Base64 encoded value of the attachment

mode.description: Defines the type of the payment

streetSplit.description: If `true` the value of `customer.street` will be split into street nameand street number

screeningOnly.description: If `true` only a pre-screening request is done.

orderNumber.description: Accarda reference number, mainly useful for B2B orders where the company doing the order might have their own ID to identify the invoice later on within their own systems.

couponAmount.description: Amount in the basket payed by coupon or other payment instruments.

countryCode.description: Passenger country code in ISO-3166-1-alpha2 format.

issueDate.description: Ticket issuing date. Must be in ISO-8601 format (`YYYY-MM-DD`).

tickets.description: A list of tickets for this purchase. Note: PAP only supports one ticket.

AirlineDataRequest.description: The airline data including ticket details.

signature.description: Signature of the payment and header data. The signature includes the signing certificate, its intermediate CA certificate, and information about the signing algorithm.

version.description: Version information about the payment token. The token uses `EC_v1` for ECC-encrypted data, and `RSA_v1` for RSA-encrypted data.

ApplePayRequest.description: The data received from Apple when integrating the 'Buy with Apple Pay' button. See https://developer.apple.com/documentation/apple_pay_on_the_web for more information.

currency.description: 3 letter ISO-4217 character code. For example `CHF` or `USD`

refno.description: The merchant's reference number. It should be unique for each transaction.

refno2.description: Optional customer's reference number. Supported by some payment methods or acquirers.

autoSettle.description: Whether to automatically settle the transaction after an authorization or not. Default is `false`.

amount.description: The amount of the transaction in the currency’s smallest unit. For example use 1000 for CHF 10.00.

street2.description: Secondary street name of the person

country.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country code of the person

sortingCode.description: The sorting code of the person

alias.description: Alias received from a previous transaction if `option.createAlias=true` was used. In order to retrieve the alias from a previous transaction, use the [Status API](#operation/status).

subtype.description: The Byjuno specific payment method used for the transaction.

alias.description: Alias received from a previous transaction if `option.createAlias=true` was used. In order to retrieve the alias from a previous transaction, use the [Status API](#operation/status).

customerEmailConfirmed.description: Indicates that the customer has confirmed the email address to the merchant

deliveryMethod.description: Can be one of POST (Delivery by Swiss Post), SHOP (Point of Sale) or HLD (Home Delivery Service)

deviceFingerprintId.description: Identification of the customer in the shop

paperInvoice.description: Whether or not to send a paper invoice.

repaymentType.description: Number from 1 to 20 to indicate the repayment schedule. This is used in combination with payment methods and defined per client configuration.

riskOwner.description: Defines which party should take the risk.

siteId.description: Can be used in case when client operates different legally separated stores / points of sale.

verifiedDocument1Type.description: Indication if merchant is having verified documents from client request.

customData.description: A list of custom data fields. It can accept up to 10 entries.

items.description: A list of custom data fields. It can accept up to 10 entries.

firstRateAmount.description: Amount of the first rate paid by the customer.

alias.description: Alias received from a previous transaction if `option.createAlias=true` was used. In order to retrieve the alias from a previous transaction, use the [Status API](#operation/status).

expiryMonth.description: The expiry month of the credit card alias.

expiryYear.description: The expiry year of the credit card alias

CardAuthorizeRequest.description: The card object to be submitted when authorizing with an existing credit card alias.

firstName.description: The first name of the customer.

lastName.description: The last name of the customer.

street2.description: Additional street information. For example: '3rd floor'

cellPhone.description: Cell Phone number of the customer.

email.description: The email address of the customer.

birthDate.description: The birth date of the customer. Must be in ISO-8601 format (`YYYY-MM-DD`).

type.description:
`P` or `C` depending on whether the customer is private or a company.
If `C`, the fields `name` and `companyRegisterNumber` are required

name.description: The name of the company. Only applicable if `type=C`

companyLegalForm.description: The legal form of the company (AG, GmbH, ...)

companyRegisterNumber.description: The register number of the company. Only applicable if `type=C`

ipAddress.description: The ip address of the customer.

CustomerRequest.description: Whenever the payment method supports `customer` details, the customer object can be used. If a particular field is required varies from payment method to payment method. For example the field `birthDate` is not mandatory for each payment method supporting the `customer` object.

xid.description: The transaction ID returned by the directory server

threeDSTransactionId.description: The transaction ID returned by the 3D Secure Provider

directoryResponse.description:
Transaction status after `ARes`

|Value|3Dv1|3Dv2|
|:---|:---|:---|
|Y| enrolled| authenticated|
|N| not enrolled| authentication failed|
|U| not available| not available|
|C| |challenge needed|
|R| |rejected|
|A| |authentication attempt|

authenticationResponse.description:
Transaction status after `RReq` (Challenge flow)

|Value|3Dv1|3Dv2|
|:---|:---|:---|
|Y| authenticated| authenticated|
|N| authentication failed| authentication failed|
|U| not available| not available|
|A| authentication attempt| authentication attempt|
|C| process incomplete| process incomplete|
|D| not enrolled| |

EMVCo3DAuthenticationDataAuthorizeReques.description: If 3D authentication data is available, the `3D` object can be used to send the relevant 3D parameters. Please get in contact with us if you have a dedicated 3D provider.

signature.description: Verifies that the message came from Google. It's Base64-encoded, and created with ECDSA by the intermediate signing key.

protocolVersion.description: Identifies the encryption or signing scheme under which the message was created. It allows the protocol to evolve over time, if needed.

signedMessage.description: A JSON object serialized as a string that contains the encryptedMessage, ephemeralPublicKey, and tag. It's serialized to simplify the signature verification process.

GooglePayRequest.description: The data received from Google when integrating the 'Buy with Google Pay' button. See https://github.com/datatrans/google-pay-web-sample for more information.

publicKeyHash.description: Hash of the X.509 encoded public key bytes of the merchant’s certificate.

transactionId.description: Transaction identifier, generated on the device.

Header.description: Additional version-dependent information used to decrypt and verify the payment.

rate.description: The preferred rate model of the installment

Installment.description: If `mode` equals `installment` this object defines the rate model of it

street.description: The street of the arena location

zipCode.description: The postal code of the arena location

city.description: The city of the arena location

country.description: The country of the arena location

subPaymentMethod.description: The Klarna specific payment method used for the transaction.

accountInfos.description: A list of Klarna customer account infos.

historySimple.description: A list of simple history entries

historyFull.description: A list of full history entries

alias.description: Alias received from a previous transaction if `option.createAlias=true` was used. In order to retrieve the alias from a previous transaction, use the [Status API](#operation/status).

uniqueIdentifier.description: A unique name or number to identify the specific customer account. Max. 24 characters.

registrationDate.description: The registration date and time of the account. Must be in ISO-8601 format (e.g. `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:ss.SSSZ`).

lastModified.description: The date and time the account was modified the last time. Must be in ISO-8601 format (e.g. `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:ss.SSSZ`).

KlarnaCustomerAccountInfo.description: A list of Klarna customer account infos.

company.description: The name of the company arranging the event.

start.description: The start date and time of the event. Must be in ISO-8601 format (e.g. `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:ss.SSSZ`).

end.description: The end date and time of the event. Must be in ISO-8601 format (e.g. `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:ss.SSSZ`).

accessControlledVenue.description: Tickets are digitally checked when entering the venue.

ticketDeliveryRecipient.description: The name of the recipient the ticket is delivered to. If the method isEMAIL or PHONE, use either the email address or the phone number.

affiliateName.description: The name of the affiliate that originated the purchase.

uniqueIdentifier.description: Unique name or number to identify the specific customer account. Max. 24 characters.

paymentOption.description: The type of the line item

paidPurchases.description: The total number of successful purchases.

totalAmountPaidPurchases.description: The total amount of successful purchases (in local currency).

lastPaidPurchase.description: The date and time of the last paid purchase. Must be in ISO-8601 format (e.g. `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:ss.SSSZ`).

firstPaidPurchase.description: The date and time of the first paid purchase. Must be in ISO-8601 format (e.g. `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:ss.SSSZ`).

KlarnaPaymentHistoryFull.description: A list of full history entries

uniqueIdentifier.description: Unique name or number to identify the specific customer account. Max. 24 characters.

paidBefore.description: Whether the customer has paid before or not.

KlarnaPaymentHistorySimple.description: A list of simple history entries

name.description: The name of the product of the subscription

start.description: The start date and time of the subscription. Must be in ISO-8601 format (e.g. `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:ss.SSSZ`).

end.description: The end date and time of the subscription. Must be in ISO-8601 format (e.g. `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:ss.SSSZ`).

autoRenewal.description: `true` if the subscription will be auto renewed upon expiry.

affiliateName.description: The name of the affiliate that originated the purchase.

departureAirport.description: The origin or departure airport code for this leg.

arrivalAirport.description: The destination or arrival airport code for this leg.

flightDate.description: Date of flight. Must be in ISO-8601 format (`YYYY-MM-DD`).

LocalTime.description: Flight's arrival time. Must be in ISO-8601 format (`hh:mm`).

subMerchantId.description: The ID of your sub-merchant as defined by your acquirer

amount.description: Your fee for your marketplace offerings that you want to take out of each operation. The acquiring fees will be automatically deducted from this amount.

currency.description: 3 letter ISO-4217 character code. For example `CHF` or `USD`

OrderRequest.description: If supported by the payment method, an order with one or more articles can be defined.

alias.description: Alias received from a previous transaction if `option.createAlias=true` was used. In order to retrieve the alias from a previous transaction, use the [Status API](#operation/status).

orderTransactionId.description: The transactionId of the order request executed previously, if this authorization is part of the order-authorize-capture (AC2) flow.

alias.description: Alias received from a previous transaction if `option.createAlias=true` was used. In order to retrieve the alias from a previous transaction, use the [Status API](#operation/status).
Alias received from a previous transaction if `option.createAlias=true` was used. In order to retrieve the alias from a previous transaction, use the [Status API](#operation/status).

expiryMonth.description: The expiry month of the Reka card alias.

expiryYear.description: The expiry year of the Reka card alias

street2.description: Secondary street name of the person

country.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country code of the person

sortingCode.description: The sorting code of the person

cellPhone.description: Cell phone number of the person

carrier.description: Shipping carrier to be used. For example: `DHL`, `Express`

price.description: Value of all items in the basket, in smallest available unit.

priceGross.description: Gross value of all items in the basket, in smallest available unit.

ShippingAddress.description: The address where the article(s) should be sent to.

passengerName.description: Name of passenger or person to whom the ticket was issued

Ticket.description: A list of tickets for this purchase. Note: PAP only supports one ticket.

alias.description: Alias received from a previous transaction if `option.createAlias=true` was used. In order to retrieve the alias from a previous transaction, use the [Status API](#operation/status).

message.description: A human readable message indicating what went wrong.

acquirerAuthorizationCode.description: The authorization code returned by the acquirer or payment method provider.

amount.description: The amount of the transaction in the currency’s smallest unit. For example use 1000 for CHF 10.00.

refno.description: The merchant's reference number. It should be unique for each transaction.

refno2.description: Optional customer's reference number. Supported by some payment methods or acquirers.

autoSettle.description: Whether to automatically settle the transaction after an authorization or not. Default is `false`.

apply.description: Decides if the 3D secure process should be applied.

CDMRequest.description: CyberSource specific parameters. Use the same properties as you would for direct CyberSource requests.

refno.description: The merchant's reference number. It should be unique for each transaction.

message.description: A human readable message indicating what went wrong.

transactionId.description: When a credit is performed, a new `transactionId` is created

acquirerAuthorizationCode.description: The authorization code returned by the acquirer or payment method provider.

amount.description: The amount of the transaction in the currency’s smallest unit. For example use 1000 for CHF 10.00.

currency.description: 3 letter ISO-4217 character code. For example `CHF` or `USD`

refno.description: The merchant's reference number. It should be unique for each transaction.

refno2.description: Optional customer's reference number. Supported by some payment methods or acquirers.

Extension.description: An object for additional data needed by some merchants for customized processes.

subMerchantId.description: The ID of your sub-merchant as defined by your acquirer

amount.description: Your fee for your marketplace offerings that you want to take out of each operation. The acquiring fees will be automatically deducted from this amount.

transactionId.description: The `transactionId` to be used when using Redirect- or Lightbox Mode. If no further action happens with the `transactionId` after initialization, it will be invalidated after 30 minutes.

mobileToken.description: Mobile token which is needed to initialize the Mobile SDKs.

enrolled.description: Whether the used credit card alias (or card number) is 3D enrolled or not.

Secure3DResponse.description: The `3D` object is only present if init call was done with an `alias`.

version.description: The version of AccommodationMetaData field (used for tracking schema changes to the field)

lengthOfStay.description: The number of nights that the accommodation was booked for.

numberOfGuests.description: The number of guests for which the accommodation is booked

startDate.description: The date on which the accommodation starts. Must be in ISO-8601 format (e.g. `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:ss.SSSZ`). Internally, Amazon will store the number of days and hours between accommodation.startDate and time of the purchase.

endDate.description: The date on which the accommodation ends. Must be in ISO-8601 format (e.g. `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:ss.SSSZ`). If accommodation.lengthOfStay is given, we default to an endDate derived from startDate and lengthOfStay.

starRating.description: Star rating of the accommodation. From 0 (for no star rating) to 5 (for five star hotels)

bookedLastTime.description: Days since the buyer booked the same accommodation last time. Use value -1 if buyer books this accommodation for the first time.

city.description: The city where the accommodation is located. Example: Milan.

countryCode.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2, two-letter country code, representing the country where the accommodation is located. Example: IT.

zipCode.description: The zip code of the accommodation address. Example: 40127.

accommodationType.description: Describes the type of accommodation, valid values:[Hotel]

accommodationName.description: The name of the accommodation, as provided to the merchant by the accommodation itself.

version.description: The version of AirlineMetaData field (used for tracking schema changes to the field)

airlineCode.description: IATA 2-letter airline code. It identifies the carrier. Example: AA (American Airlines)

flightDate.description: Flight departure date. Must be in ISO-8601 format (e.g. `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:ss.SSSZ`). The time mentioned here is local time

departureAirport.description: IATA 3-letter code of the departure airport. Example: CDG

destinationAirport.description: IATA 3-letter code of the departure airport. Example: LUX

bookedLastTime.description: Days since the buyer booked a flight to the same destination last time. Use value -1 if buyer books this destination for the first time.

hotelName.description: Name of the hotel. Mandatory when businessType is Hotel.

checkinTime.description: Hotel checkin time. Mandatory when business type is Hotel. Must be in ISO-8601 format (e.g. `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:ss.SSSZ`).

checkoutTime.description: Hotel checkout time. Mandatory when business type is Hotel. Must be in ISO-8601 format (e.g. `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:ss.SSSZ`).

flightNumber.description: Flight number, e.g. LX1234. Mandatory when businessType is Aviation.

departureTime.description: The flight departure time. Mandatory when businessType is Aviation. Must be in ISO-8601 format (e.g. `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:ss.SSSZ`).

admissionNoticeUrl.description: The picture address of admission notice.Mandatory when business type is [ Overseas | Education | Affairs ].

goodsInfo.description: Goods information. Mandatory when business type is Retailing.

totalQuantity.description: Quantities of goods. Mandatory when business type is Retailing.

otherBusinessType.description: Name of business type. Mandatory when business type is Other.

AmazonFraudContext.description: Supplementary data for fraud detection by amazon

sellerNote.description: Represents a description of the billing agreement that is shown in emails to the buyer and on the Amazon Pay website.

version.description: The version of BuyerMetaData field (used for tracking schema changes to the field).

isFirstTimeCustomer.description: True if the buyer is purchasing from the merchant for the first time. Else false.

numberOfPastPurchases.description: The number of purchases the buyer has made from the merchant in the past.

numberOfDisputedPurchases.description: The number of purchases that has been disputed by the buyer when making purchases from the merchant.

hasOpenDispute.description: True if the buyer has an ongoing dispute regarding a past purchase.

riskScore.description: The risk score which the merchant computes for a buyer. The value must be a decimal in the range between 0 (lowest risk) and 1 (highest risk).

userAgent.description: The user agent of the browser used by the buyer to make the purchase on merchant site. Example: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_12_6) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/70.0.3538.102 Safari/537.36.

language.description: Language in which the buyer is viewing the site at the time of placing the order in 'language-LOCALE' format example: en-US. Use ISO 639-1:2002 code for the language part (en) and ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 for the LOCALE part (US).

recipientEmailMatches.description: True, if the recipient email is exactly the same as the one on the amazon account used for payment, false otherwise.

buyerIsATraveler.description: True, if the account holder of the amazon account is actually one of the travelers, false otherwise.

alias.description: Alias received from a previous transaction if `option.createAlias=true` was used. In order to retrieve the alias from a previous transaction, use the [Status API](#operation/status).

expiryMonth.description: The expiry month of the credit card alias.

expiryYear.description: The expiry year of the credit card alias

createAliasCVV.description: Specifies whether a CVV alias should be created

CardInitRequest.description: The card object to be submitted when initializing a transaction with an existing alias. The inner `3D` object can be used to submit all mandatory, conditional and optional 3D 2.0 parameters.

bankbic.description: Identification of the customer’s (buyer’s) financial institution by a BIC.

orderInfoText.description: Text between the beneficiary/merchant and the buyer which will not be part of the payment instruction. If submitted, the final orderInfoText will be: `refno + ' ' + orderInfoText`

currency.description: 3 letter ISO-4217 character code. For example `CHF` or `USD`

refno.description: The merchant's reference number. It should be unique for each transaction.

refno2.description: Optional customer's reference number. Supported by some payment methods or acquirers.

autoSettle.description: Whether to automatically settle the transaction after an authorization or not. Default is `false`.

amount.description: The amount of the transaction in the currency’s smallest unit. For example use 1000 for CHF 10.00. Can be omitted for use cases where only a registration should take place (if the payment method supports registrations)

language.description: This parameter specifies the language (language code) in which the payment page should be presented to the cardholder. The ISO-639-1 two letter language codes listed above are supported

paymentMethods.description: An array of payment method shortnames. For example `["VIS", "PFC"]`. If omitted, all available payment methods will be displayed on the payment page.

items.description: An array of payment method shortnames. For example `["VIS", "PFC"]`. If omitted, all available payment methods will be displayed on the payment page.

subPaymentMethod.description: The Klarna specific payment method used for the transaction.

accountInfos.description: A list of Klarna customer account infos.

historySimple.description: A list of simple history entries

historyFull.description: A list of full history entries

alias.description: Alias received from a previous transaction if `option.createAlias=true` was used. In order to retrieve the alias from a previous transaction, use the [Status API](#operation/status).
Alias received from a previous transaction if `option.createAlias=true` was used. In order to retrieve the alias from a previous transaction, use the [Status API](#operation/status).

createAlias.description: Whether an alias should be created for this transaction or not. If set to `true` an alias will be created. This alias can then be used to [initialize](#operation/init) or [authorize](#operation/authorize) a transaction. One possible use case is to charge the card of an existing (registered) cardholder.

returnMaskedCardNumber.description: Whether to return the masked card number. Format: `520000xxxxxx0080`

returnCustomerCountry.description: If set to `true`, the country of the customers issuer will be returned.

authenticationOnly.description: Whether to only authenticate the transaction (3D process only). If set to `true`, the actual authorization will not take place.

rememberMe.description: Whether to show a checkbox on the payment page to let the customer choose if they want to save their card information.

returnMobileToken.description: Indicates that a mobile token should be created. This is needed when using our Mobile SDKs.

version.description: The version of OrderMetaData field (used for tracking schema changes to the field).

numberOfItems.description: The number of items that the order contains. For example, two cups of coffee.

type.description: Type of items. Physical, Digital, Mixed

relatedOrderReferenceId.description: Order ID of the related order. For the deposit this field will be empty, while for any subsequent payment related to the same booking this will be the order ID of the deposit transaction.

numberOfChildren.description: The number of passengers who are children (ages 2 to 18)

numberOfInfants.description: The number of passengers who are under the age of 2

alias.description: Alias received from a previous transaction if `option.createAlias=true` was used. In order to retrieve the alias from a previous transaction, use the [Status API](#operation/status).

imageUrl.description: A https URL to the logo of the merchant.

displayShippingDetails.description:
Regulates whether the shipping details are displayed or not.
(Note: `forwardCustomerDetails` and `displayShippingDetails` should be set
to `no` if the shipping details should not be shown on the PayPal page.

forwardCustomerDetails.description: `true` if the customer details (if submitted) should be forwarded to PayPal. Default is `false`.

returnCustomerDetails.description: `true` if the customer details should be retrieved from PayPal.

createOrder.description: `true` if a PayPal AC2 order is to be created. Default is `false`.

alias.description: Alias received from a previous transaction if `option.createAlias=true` was used. In order to retrieve the alias from a previous transaction, use the [Status API](#operation/status).

successUrl.description: The URL where the customer gets redirected to if the transaction was successful.

cancelUrl.description: The URL where the customer gets redirected to if the transaction was canceled.

errorUrl.description: The URL where the customer gets redirected to if an error occurred.

startTarget.description: If the payment is started within an iframe or when using the Lightbox Mode, use value `_top`. This ensures a proper browser flow for payment methods who need a redirect.

returnTarget.description: If the payment is started within an iframe or when using the Lightbox Mode, use `_top` if the redirect URLs should be opened full screen when payment returns from a 3rd party (for example 3D).

method.description: The preferred HTTP method for the redirect request (`GET` or `POST`). When using GET as a method, the query string parameter `datatransTrxId` will be added to the corresponding return url upon redirection. In case of POST, all the query parameters from the corresponding return url will be moved to the application/x-www-form-urlencoded body of the redirection request along with the added `datatransTrxId` parameter.

RedirectRequest.description: The redirect object is used to customize the browser behaviour when using the payment page (Redirect or Lightbox Mode) to do a transaction.

alias.description: Alias received from a previous transaction if `option.createAlias=true` was used. In order to retrieve the alias from a previous transaction, use the [Status API](#operation/status).

ThreeDSecure.description: Refer to the official EMVCo 3D specification 2.1.0 for parameter requirements.

TransactionContext.description: PayPal transaction context specific parameters. Use the same properties as you would for direct Transaction Context requests

alias.description: Alias received from a previous transaction if `option.createAlias=true` was used. In order to retrieve the alias from a previous transaction, use the [Status API](#operation/status).

theme.description: The theme (including configuration options) to be used when rendering the payment page.

textColor.description: The color of the text in the header bar if no logo is given

logoBorderColor.description: Decides whether the logo shall be styled with a border around it, if the value is true the default background color is chosen, else the provided string is used as color value

brandButton.description: Decides if the pay button should have the same color as the brandColor. If set to false the hex color #01669F will be used as a default

payButtonTextColor.description: The color (hex) of the pay button

logoSrc.description: An SVG image provided by the merchant. The image needs to be uploaded by using the Datatrans Web Administration Tool

initialView.description: Wheter the payment page shows the payment method selection as list (default) or as a grid

brandTitle.description: If set to `false` and no logo is used (see `logoSrc`), the payment page header will be empty

themeConfiguration.description: Theme configuration options when using the default `DT2015` theme

transactionId.description: The `transactionId` to be used when calling SecureFields.init(). If no further action happens with the `transactionId` after initialization, it will be invalidated after 30 minutes.

amount.description: The amount of the transaction in the currency’s smallest unit. For example use 1000 for CHF 10.00.

currency.description: 3 letter ISO-4217 character code. For example `CHF` or `USD`

returnUrl.description: The URL where the browser will be redirected after the 3D authentication process.

amount.description: The newly to be used amount in the currency’s smallest unit. For example use 1000 for CHF 10.00.

currency.description: 3 letter ISO-4217 character code. For example `CHF` or `USD`

amount.description: Your fee for your marketplace offerings that you want to take out of each operation. The acquiring fees will be automatically deducted from this amount.

currency.description: 3 letter ISO-4217 character code. For example `CHF` or `USD`

subMerchantId.description: The ID of your sub-merchant as defined by your acquirer

closeTransaction.description: Defines if the transaction should be closed for further settlements. Switch the value from `false` to `true` in your last settlement request.

amount.description: The amount of the transaction in the currency’s smallest unit. For example use 1000 for CHF 10.00.

currency.description: 3 letter ISO-4217 character code. For example `CHF` or `USD`

refno.description: The merchant's reference number. It should be unique for each transaction.

refno2.description: Optional customer's reference number. Supported by some payment methods or acquirers.

autoSettle.description: Indicates if auto settlement was used. Only applicable if action was `authorize`

date.description: Date when the action was performed.

success.description: Whether the action was successful or not.

ip.description: The IP address from where the action originated from.

acquirerAuthorizationCode.description: The authorization code returned by the acquirer or payment method provider.

alias.description: Alias received from a previous transaction if `option.createAlias=true` was used. In order to retrieve the alias from a previous transaction, use the [Status API](#operation/status).

ByjunoDetail.description: If INT was used for a transaction the object holds all Byjuno relevant properties.

CDMResponse.description: The response of the cybersource decision manager.

reversal.description: Whether the transaction was reversed on acquirer side.

alias.description: Alias received from a previous transaction if `option.createAlias=true` was used. In order to retrieve the alias from a previous transaction, use the [Status API](#operation/status).

masked.description: Masked credit card number. Can be used to display on a users profile page. For example: `424242xxxxxx4242`

aliasCVV.description: Alias of the CVV. Will be deleted immediately after authorization.

expiryMonth.description: The expiry month of the credit card alias.

expiryYear.description: The expiry year of the credit card alias

CardDetail.description: If a credit card payment method was used for a transaction the `card` object holds all relevant properties for the used card.

brand.description: The brand of the credit card (e.g. VISA CREDIT).

type.description: The type of the card (`credit` or `debit`). The property will not be present if the card type is unknown

usage.description: The usage of the card (`consumer`, `corporate` or `unknown`)

CardInfo.description: The card information if the request was done with a card object

name.description: The full name of the customer.

firstName.description: The first name of the customer.

lastName.description: The last name of the customer.

Customer.description: Customer details. Returned only if collected by the payment page. Setup dependent.

Detail.description: Details about the various action steps of the transaction.

xid.description: The transaction ID returned by the directory server

threeDSTransactionId.description: The transaction ID returned by the 3D Secure Provider

directoryResponse.description:
Transaction status after `ARes`

|Value|3Dv1|3Dv2|
|:---|:---|:---|
|Y| enrolled| authenticated|
|N| not enrolled| authentication failed|
|U| not available| not available|
|C| |challenge needed|
|R| |rejected|
|A| |authentication attempt|

authenticationResponse.description:
Transaction status after `RReq` (Challenge flow)

|Value|3Dv1|3Dv2|
|:---|:---|:---|
|Y| authenticated| authenticated|
|N| authentication failed| authentication failed|
|U| not available| not available|
|A| authentication attempt| authentication attempt|
|C| process incomplete| process incomplete|
|D| not enrolled| |

cardHolderInfo.description: Text provided by the ACS/Issuer to Cardholder during a transaction that was not authenticated by the ACS. The Issuer can optionally provide information to Cardholder. For example, "Additional authentication is needed for this transaction, please contact (Issuer Name) at xxx-xxx-xxxx."

transStatusReason.description:
Transaction status reason

|Value|Description|
|:---|:---|
|01| Card authentication failed|
|02| Unknown Device|
|03| Unsupported Device|
|04| Exceeds authentication frequency limit|
|05| Expired card|
|06| Invalid card number|
|07| Invalid transaction|
|08| No Card record|
|09| Security failure|
|10| Stolen card|
|11| Suspected fraud|
|12| Transaction not permitted to cardholder|
|13| Cardholder not enrolled in service|
|14| Transaction timed out at the ACS|
|15| Low confidence|
|16| Medium confidence|
|17| High confidence|
|18| Very High confidence|
|19| Exceeds ACS maximum challenges|
|20| Non-Payment transaction not supported|
|21| 3RI transaction not supported|
|22| ACS technical issue|
|23| Decoupled Authentication required by ACS but not requested by 3DS Requestor|
|24| 3DS Requestor Decoupled Max Expiry Time exceeded|
|25| Decoupled Authentication was provided insufficient time to authenticate cardholder. ACS will not make attempt|
|26| Authentication attempted but not performed by the cardholder|
|27–79| Reserved for EMVCo future use (values invalid until defined by EMVCo)|
|80–99 | Reserved for DS use|

alias.description: Alias received from a previous transaction if `option.createAlias=true` was used. In order to retrieve the alias from a previous transaction, use the [Status API](#operation/status).

reason.description: The failure reason if an error occurred.

message.description: A detailed message describing the occurred error.

expires.description: Tells when the initialized transaction will expire if not continued - 30 minutes after initialization.

orderId.description: The PayPal orderId, if the transaction was a PayPal order.

alias.description: Alias received from a previous transaction if `option.createAlias=true` was used. In order to retrieve the alias from a previous transaction, use the [Status API](#operation/status).

PayPalDetail.description: If PayPal was used for a transaction the object holds all PayPal relevant properties.

PostfinanceDetail.description: If PFC was used for a transaction the object holds all Postfinance relevant properties.

subtype.description: The REKA payment subtype. REK for REKA Check, REL for REKA Lunch, RER for REKA Rail.

RekaDetail.description: If Reka was used for a transaction the object holds all Reka relevant properties.

transactionId.description: The transactionId received after an authorization.

currency.description: 3 letter ISO-4217 character code. For example `CHF` or `USD`

refno.description: The merchant's reference number. It should be unique for each transaction.

refno2.description: Optional customer's reference number. Supported by some payment methods or acquirers.

alias.description: The Twint alias.

TwintDetail.description: If Twint was used for a transaction the object holds all Twint relevant properties.

signature.description: Signature of the payment and header data. The signature includes the signing certificate, its intermediate CA certificate, and information about the signing algorithm.

version.description: Version information about the payment token. The token uses `EC_v1` for ECC-encrypted data, and `RSA_v1` for RSA-encrypted data.

ApplePayValidateRequest.description: Apple Pay specific parameters for the validate request.

alias.description: Alias received from a previous transaction if `option.createAlias=true` was used. In order to retrieve the alias from a previous transaction, use the [Status API](#operation/status).

expiryMonth.description: The expiry month of the credit card alias.

expiryYear.description: The expiry year of the credit card alias

CardValidateRequest.description: The card object to be submitted when validating with an existing credit card alias.

signature.description: Verifies that the message came from Google. It's Base64-encoded, and created with ECDSA by the intermediate signing key.

protocolVersion.description: Identifies the encryption or signing scheme under which the message was created. It allows the protocol to evolve over time, if needed.

signedMessage.description: A JSON object serialized as a string that contains the encryptedMessage, ephemeralPublicKey, and tag. It's serialized to simplify the signature verification process.
